data.enText: a person who expresses opinions about the good and bad qualities of books, music, etc.

data.chText: 音乐、戏剧、文学等评论家

data.enText: a person who expresses disapproval of sb/sth and talks about their bad qualities, especially publicly

data.chText: 她是最直言不讳地批评执政党的一个人。
data.enText: She is one of the ruling party's most outspoken critics.

data.chText: 对私人卫生保健持批评态度的人
data.enText: a critic of private health care

simple_means.memory_skill: crit 判断 + ic 人 → 判断〔别人的是非〕的人 → 批评家

tr: someone who frequently finds fault or makes harsh and unfair judgments
anyone who expresses a reasoned judgment of something
a person who is professionally engaged in the analysis and interpretation of works of art

value.def: A critic is a person who writes about and expresses opinions about things such as books, films, music, or art.

example.ex: Mather was film critic on the Daily Telegraph for many years...
example.tran: 马瑟多年来一直担任《每日电讯报》的影评人。

example.ex: The New York critics had praised her performance.
example.tran: 纽约的影评家们高度评价了她的表演。

value.def: Someone who is a critic of a person or system disapproves of them and criticizes them publicly.

example.ex: The newspaper has been the most consistent critic of the government...
example.tran: 一直以来，该报批评政府的立场最为坚定。

example.ex: He became a fierce critic of the tobacco industry...
example.tran: 他成了烟草业的强烈反对者。

example.ex: Her critics accused her of caring only about success.
example.tran: 批评者指责她只在乎成功。

trans: 艺术评论家；艺术批评家

partsOfSpeech.dec: atom 原子 + ic …的 → 原子的；原子能的
cosm 世界，宇宙 + ic …的 → 宇宙的
organ 器官 + ic …的 → 有机的；器官的
poet 诗歌 + ic …的 → 有诗意的
stat 站 + ic …的 → 站着不动 → 静态的
crit 判断 + ic 人 → 判断〔别人的是非〕的人 → 批评家
mim 模仿的 + ic 人 → 模仿者
psychot〔= psycho精神〕+ ic 人 → 精神有问题的人 → 精神病人
scept 怀疑 + ic 人 → 怀疑论者
arithm 计算，数学 + et 表名词 + ic …学，…术 → 算术
log 说话 + ic …学，…术 → 说话的学问 → 逻辑学
rhetor 修辞学大师 + ic …学，…术 → 修辞学
an 无 + alges 痛 + ic 某种药 → 止痛药
an 无 + esthet 感觉 + ic 某种药 → 使人无感觉的药 → 麻醉剂
anti 抗 + sept 烂 + ic 某种药 → 防止腐烂的药 → 杀菌剂
